base_prompt.S: Curate a playlist of hip hop tracks.

prompt.S: Focus on 90s melodic hip hop: warm boom-bap drums, soulful hooks, smooth flows, and feel-good grooves. Prioritise classic-era artists and deep cuts; avoid aggressive/gangsta extremes.
Classic boom bap: hard but not harshâ€”crisp snares, dusty samples, head-nod tempo, lyrical focus. Mix iconic staples with underground gems; minimise trap-style hi-hats and EDM crossover.
Jazz rap: upright bass, Rhodes keys, sax/trumpet, brushed drums, swing-inflected grooves. Keep it laid-back and sophisticated; blend classics with modern jazz-leaning cuts.
Conscious hip hop: thoughtful, uplifting, socially aware lyrics with soulful production. Keep the energy positive-to-reflective; avoid shock-rap and overly dark themes.
Alternative/indie hip hop: left-field production, creative arrangements, off-kilter but listenable. Include tasteful experimental cuts without going full noise/industrial; avoid EDM bangers.
Lo-fi hip hop: mellow beats, tape hiss, soft chords, minimal vocals (instrumentals welcome). Keep it calming and consistent; avoid high-energy club tracks.
Chill trap: modern 808s and rolling hats but smooth/airy, not abrasive. Prefer melodic hooks, restrained aggression, and mid-tempo bounce; avoid rage/hypertrap and screamo-adjacent vocals.
Southern hip hop: bounce, swagger, and groove from classic southern sounds through modern, but keep it party-fun rather than chaotic. Mix recognisable anthems with tasteful deep cuts.
West Coast: G-funk synth leads, funky basslines, sunny cruising energy plus modern west-coast bounce. Keep it smooth and confident; avoid overly violent/drill-adjacent cuts.
UK hip hop + accessible grime: sharp flows, crisp rhythms, but keep it approachable. Prefer groove and charisma over abrasive aggressiveness; include a few classics and modern standouts.
Melodic drill: sliding 808s and modern drum patterns with strong melodies and controlled intensity. Keep it more atmospheric than threatening; avoid ultra-violent lyrics where possible.
